item.title: In Defense of Tooling
item.description: A quote (on a curriculum vitae) that I’ve enjoyed: I am a firm believer in the value of tools, and often spend significant time at the beginning of a project developing tools specific to the needs of the project. This always pays off in the long run. I use tools to: Perform tasks not otherwise achievable Automate tedious/repetative processes Simplify steps in the build/debug cycle Eliminate “human error” in scanning, translation etc.
